The extent of the QIC has been affected by the increase in Andean surface temperature
9, 10 , but potentially also by variations in precipitation
4, 11 . The El Ni√±o - Southern Oscillation (ENSO)
8 , the South American Summer Monsoon (SASM)
12 , and cold air incursions from the extratropics
13 also affect QIC conditions on an interannual time scale. However, no continuous surface mass balance and ice dynamics measurements exist on QIC; hence the relationship between the reduction in surface area and loss of glacier mass is not known.
